intro: Chamaecrista serpens var. serpens, commonly known as the serpentine sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the seeds are enclosed in slender, spirally twisted pods. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
